intro: Cenocline chamaemelifolia, commonly known as the rock rose, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to the Mediterranean region. The plant features small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, adapted to thrive in rocky or gravelly soils. Cenocline chamaemelifolia is often used in rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
